summary: In this chapter, the importance of evaluating friendships is emphasized, encouraging readers to determine which relationships are worth nurturing. The author shares her strategy of keeping track of friends to maintain connections, even when busy. A simple one-line message can significantly improve a friendship’s health, reminding both parties of their value to each other. Maintenance of familial relationships, although more complex, can be approached with the same mindset. Small, consistent efforts can lead to healthier, more fulfilling connections.

slides.section_body: Begin by being honest with yourself about your friendships. Determine if they are worth the time and emotional investment. This clarity is essential for maintaining meaningful connections.
slides.quote: Is this friendship worth it, or not?

slides.section_body: Recognize that there are times in life when priorities shift. When deadlines loom, it’s easy to become reclusive and neglect even the closest friendships. Reflect on how you can balance productivity with social engagement.
slides.quote: What you focus on determines what fades away.

slides.section_body: Maintain a running list of friends you want to reconnect with, especially during busy periods. This visual reminder can help keep your intentions clear and your priorities aligned.
slides.quote: It’s a simple way to ensure you don’t forget those who matter.

slides.section_title: Send a Quick 'Thinking of You' Message
slides.section_body: A one-line email or message can go a long way in reinforcing your friendships. It conveys thoughtfulness and ensures that your friends feel valued.
slides.quote: A little effort can reset the clock on friendship.

slides.section_body: Relationships with family can be more complicated, but they also require maintenance, just like friendships. Identify which familial connections need nurturing and approach them methodically.
slides.quote: Can’t live with ‘em, can’t live without ‘em.

slides.section_body: Just like brushing your teeth, maintaining relationships is about consistent, small efforts. Daily habits can strengthen connections and keep them minty fresh.
slides.quote: A little maintenance goes a long way.

slides.section_body: When your workload increases, remind yourself to carve out time for friends and family. Relationships thrive on presence and engagement.
slides.quote: True connection requires time and attention.

slides.section_body: Even brief conversations or exchanges can have a lasting effect on relationships. Make every moment count, no matter how short.
slides.quote: It’s the quality, not the quantity, that matters.

slides.section_body: Understand that you, too, are worthy of connection and nurturing relationships. Don’t shy away from investing in those who uplift your spirit.
slides.quote: Valuing yourself is key to valuing others.

slides.section_body: Be intentional about the relationships you cherish. Think of them as essential aspects of your life that require care and focus.
